channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 24-26 Seymour Street rubbish bags need to clear out, 2nd September
item.description:
24-26 Seymour Street outside pavement dumped bags of rubbish general waste and recycling waste need to clear out causing nuisance.

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Wc1v 6dw, 2nd September
item.description:
Extremely dangerous cycle Lane. The cycle lane along proctor street has been coloured in yellow at junctions with adjacent roads using road markings. This has caused the entire width of the cycle lane to be extremely slippy during wet weather. It is clear this cycle lane causes many slips as the cycle lane is covered in black tire marks where people have skidded or slipped of the bicycle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Lion Square, Holborn, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Derv white Diesel box abandoned at side of foot path, 2nd September
item.description:
A presumably emptyish white derv white diesel box and associated bits is abandoned at the side of the footpath at the entrance to Elmers End station slip road. Presumably this is hazardous?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover . When bus drives over it makes a very loud noise 24 hours, 2nd September
item.description:
Loose manhole cover . When bus drives over it makes a very loud noise 24 hours. Sound like fun fire as it echoes across the street, keeping me awake at night. Been going on for 2 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 330, Kingsland Road, Dalston, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees, 2nd September
item.description:
The trees behind 145 are overgrown and are hanging over residents property these need cutting back urgently this is a public footpath and alot of kids hang around on this footpath. also the tree/Bushes in the Ally's In Ingleton avenue are also overgrown could this be checked as needs cutting back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
